title: If lock chooses low price, so does Star

content.question:
The table below shows the profits associated with the strategies of two oligopolistic firms, Lock and Star, that must choose between a high price and a low price for their products. The first entry in each box is the profits received by Lock, and the second entry is the profits received by Star.

If Lock chooses to charge the low price, the best course of action for Star would be to charge the

choices.label: low price and earn a profit of $40
low price and earn a profit of $50
high price and earn a profit of $50
high price and earn a profit of $70
high price and incur a loss of $20

content.answer: low price and earn a profit of $40

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
